RECORD.TEXT: PUOMC 70648 12/25/1996 12:00:00 AM ATRIAL FIBRILLATION . DIS Report Status : NAME : LENKPRUSKIHKOOGLEKIH , NIEKERO C 449-50-82 12/25/96 12/29/96 PRINCIPAL DIAGNOSIS : Atrial fibrillation . PRINCIPAL PROCEDURE : Electrical cardioversion . At that time , she had clear coronary arteries on coronary angiography and an ejection fraction greater than 50% . She was started on Coumadin and had a failed attempt at DC electrical cardioversion on 11/16/96 . She has been on Coumadin since and has continued to have occasional palpitations and mild shortness of breath . Includes a history of hypertension ; multinodular goiter ; subtotal thyroidectomy . MEDICATIONS : ALLERGIES : On examination , blood pressure was 200/100 ; heart rate 120 per minute ( atrial fibrillation ) . Heart sounds were normal . The lungs were clear . There was no peripheral edema . Pulses were all easily palpable . LABORATORY DATA : A 12-lead electrocardiogram showed atrial fibrillation with a QT interval of .46 seconds . There were diffuse ST segment and T-wave abnormalities , which were nonspecific . A complete blood count , electrolytes , BUN and creatinine were within normal limits . INR was elevated at 2.5 . An echocardiogram was performed , which showed completely normal left ventricular systolic function with an ejection fraction calculated at .74 . There was no evidence of left ventricular hypertrophy or asymmetric septal hypertrophy , which had been an issue that had been raised on an echocardiogram in Ownra Cin , New Mexico on 12/06/96 . The Propafenone was stopped , and the patient was changed to Amiodarone 400 mg t.i.d. , which was continued for two days . The patient was discharged to home on Amiodarone 200 mg daily on 12/29/96 . She will continue her Coumadin until then and arrangements for her readmission can be made through Dr. Iceca Rhaltkaaispehbreun 's office here . Other than the addition of Amiodarone 200 mg daily , will be the same as her admission medications . STA BODEJOVE , M.D. DICTATING FOR : ICECA RHALTKAAISPEHBREUN , M.D. cc : Dr. Ther Ludzjesc Director , Section of Cardiology Shiekeu Hospital Medical Centers NC DD : 12/29/96 12/29/96 10:03 A
